intro: Rudgea foveolata, commonly known as the yellow rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rudgea foveolata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
